notes.note: Prerequisite: previous course work in biology and sociology and health or a related area or permission of instructor.
Two field trips are required.
Prerequisite: one year introductory biology or written permission of instructor. May not be taken for credit after BIOPL 2480.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Nutritional Quality Improvement of Food Crops

notes.note: Prerequisite: one majors-level biology course or permission of instructors.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Light and Video Microscopy for Biologists

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Concepts and Techniques in Plant Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOMG 2810 and BIOMG 3300, BIOMG 3330, BIOMG 3350 or BIOMG 3320, or equivalents. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 3310.

Prerequisite: previous enrollment in course to be taught or equivalent. Arts students may not count this course toward graduation but may, upon petition (one time only) to their class dean, carry fewer than 12 other credits and remain in good standing. This would affect Dean's List eligibility but not eligibility for graduating with distinction. submit an Independent Study Form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study). Do not sign into section 601. You will be put in the course after submitting form online.
Requirement for: graduate students doing work in plant biology.
Enrollment limited to and required for: second-, third-, and fourth-year graduate students in Plant Biology.
Enrollment preference given to: graduate students who are working with faculty members on an individual basis. Sign into your faculty members section.
